intro: Leuconoe alpestris, commonly known as the alpine leuconoe, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Leuconoe alpestris is often found in alpine meadows and is a symbol of mountainous ecosystems.
